Article Title: Man held in UP for Rs 3 crore 'digital arrest' con
Article Text: Uttarakhand STF and state cyber police arrested a 27-year-old man from Bahraich, UP, in a joint operation Sunday for allegedly defrauding a man of Rs 3 crore by placing him under " digital arrest " at the latter's house in Dehradun's Rajpur area, reports Kalyan Das. Accused Manoj Kumar was arrested during probe into a fraud case registered in May. Victim had alleged that Kumar called him on WhatsApp on May 20, claiming that security agencies had seized a parcel in his name containing drugs and passports. Posing as an officer of Greater Mumbai police, Kumar threatened to book him in a money laundering and drug trafficking case and forced him to transfer the amount to clear his name. Over the next two days, Kumar put the man in a "digital arrest" and maintained constant contact with him through WhatsApp video and voice calls. Kumar was tracked down using his phone numbers and bank account information.
Article Summary: Accused Manoj Kumar was arrested during probe into a fraud case registered in May. Victim alleged that Kumar called him on WhatsApp on May 20, claiming that security agencies had seized a parcel in his name containing drugs and passports. Kumar threatened to book him in a money laundering and drug trafficking case and forced him to transfer the amount to clear his name.

Article Title: Maharashtra polls: Juma Masjid trustee Shoaib Khatib to contest Mumbadevi seat on Azad Samaj Party ticket
Article Text: MUMBAI: Trustee of the iconic Juma Masjid, Shoaib Khatib , will contest from Mumbadevi on Azad Samaj Party (ASP) ticket. Congress ’s Amin Patel is a three-time MLA from here and has been nominated again while Mahayuti is yet to announce its candidate in this constituency, one of the highly congested areas in South Mumbai.Khatib had also fought the Lok Sabha election from Mumbai South earlier this year on a BSP ticket. Arvind Sawant of Shiv Sena (UBT) won this seat, defeating Yamini Jadhav of Shiv Sena (Shinde). Jadhav is now contesting the Byculla seat.“I am contesting the Mumbadevi seat on ASP ticket and my party is planning to field candidates in 20-22 seats in the state. We will finalise it soon,” said Khatib who said he was among those who had welcomed Chandrashekhar Azad, ASP president and MP from Nagina (UP), to the city for the Eid-e-Milad (Prophet Mohammed’s birthday celebrations) procession recently.Will he not be blamed for cutting into Muslim seats of the Congress in the constituency? “Why is this question asked from other parties? What has Congress done for the Muslims? One party should not have monopoly over a community’s votes,” said Khatib.Mumbadevi is a very congested area and comprises Mandvi, Dongri , parts of Khetwadi and Bhuleshwar. The creaky infrastructure, including old, dilapidated buildings, many hug-rises too but inadequate parking causes traffic jams.Dongri was once a den of many underworld goons. Now several good schools have come up here and have helped change the image of Dongri. Dongri also has a couple of famous Shia mosques and imambadas.Before Patel who has represented the constituency for three ters and has been nominated again, BJP's Rajpurohit represented Mumbadevi four times. It has a significant Muslim population, then Gujarati-Marwari as well as South Indians too.
Article Summary: Shoaib Khatib will contest from Mumbadevi on Azad Samaj Party (ASP) ticket. Congress’s Amin Patel is a three-time MLA from here and has been nominated again. Mahayuti is yet to announce its candidate in this constituency.

Article Title: Stalin son's rare Diwali wishes draw BJP's 'Narakasura' jibe
Article Text: CHENNAI: In a rare departure from DMK 's traditions, Tamil Nadu deputy CM Udhayanidhi Stalin has extended Diwali greetings to those "who have faith," remarks that drew sarcastic response from opposition BJP BJP has been targeting DMK for not wishing people on Hindu festivals, including Diwali and Vinayaka Chathurthi. DMK members including its late president and former CM M Karunanidhi had not greeted people, in line with their rationalistic beliefs.However, at a party event Saturday, while extending his greetings to supporters for the party's platinum jubilee celebrations, Udhayanidhi said: "I extend my greetings on our (DMK) platinum jubilee celebrations; Deepa oli thirunaal greetings to those having belief and celebrating it," he said.TN BJP's Narayanan Thirupathi took a swipe at Udhayanidhi. In a post on X, he referred to the deputy CM's comments and said, "for those who don't have belief, greetings to live like Narakasura."
Article Summary: Tamil Nadu deputy CM Udhayanidhi Stalin has extended Diwali greetings to those "who have faith" Remarks drew sarcastic response from opposition BJP BJP has been targeting DMK for not wishing people on Hindu festivals. DMK members including late president and former CM M Karunanidhi had not greeted people.

Article Title: 2 arrested for Mishra's murder in Bahraich, 2 others for arson
Article Text: LUCKNOW: Uttar Pradesh police Sunday arrested four persons in connection with violence that broke out in Maharajganj area of Bahraich during Durga idol immersion on Oct 13. Two were arrested for murder of Ram Gopal Mishra, and two others were held for arson and vandalism that occurred after Mishra was shot.Police said a review of CCTV camera footage and intelligence gathering showed accused Maruf and Nankau were on the rooftop from where Sarfaraz, allegedly opened fire at Mishra. Police detained the two near a bridge. Sarfaraz, his brother Talim, and three others, were arrested on Oct 17.In the second case, Sushil Kumar Dwivedi & Mannu were held for indulging in arson and vandalism on Oct 14. Police said they set afire vehicles, house and looted homes across Maharajganj, Maheshpurwa, Jot Chandpara and Parsohana. So far, police have arrested 100 people and lodged 15 FIRs in this connection.
Article Summary: Two were arrested for murder of Ram Gopal Mishra, and two others were held for arson and vandalism that occurred after Mishra was shot. Police said they set afire vehicles, house and looted homes across Maharajganj, Maheshpurwa, Jot Chandpara and Parsohana.

Article Title: State-sponsored infiltration in West Bengal, says Shah, TMC hits back
Article Text: KOLKATA: Peace can be established in Bengal only when infiltration stops, said Union home minister Amit Shah on Sunday. Urging voters to give BJP a chance, Shah said, "Bengal is witnessing state-sponsored infiltration. To stop this, you have to vote BJP to govern the state. Rabindra Sangeet has been replaced by bomb blasts. Only BJP can put an end to cattle smuggling, coal smuggling, corruption and syndicate raj," he said.Launching BJP's national membership drive, Shah said, "2026 will be a milestone in the assembly polls in Bengal. BJP will win the election with two-thirds majority.""When you join BJP in Bengal, you also join the movement to free the state from the terror of Communists and Mamata didi," Shah said.Referring to BJP's dismal performance in the state in recent elections, he added: "Mamata didi is happy seeing a lower seat tally for BJP. She thinks BJP has slackened pace in Bengal. Her happiness is not going to last long."Earlier, opening a new passenger terminal at Petrapole, Shah said that people in Bengal were not getting benefits of Central schemes. "If voted to power, BJP will roll out all Central schemes in Bengal. MGNREGA workers would get their pay. Aap ke achche din dur nahin (good days are not far off)," he said.Setting a target of enrolling 1 crore members in the next 20 days for his party colleagues, Shah said, "...BJP swept the polls in MP, Rajasthan and Odisha. Our govt was formed in Haryana for the third term, and I can assure BJP govt in Maharashtra and Jharkhand. Our next big target is Bengal.""Modiji officially recognised Bangla as one of the classical languages of India, fulfilling the dream of cultural icons like Jaidev, Mahakavi Chandidas, Rabindranath Tagore, Bankimchandra Chattopadhyay and Saratchandra Chattopadhyay. Mamata did not even express gratitude to him for granting Bangla classical language status," Shah added.Referring to the RG Kar Medical College rape-murder, the home minister said: "Women are being tortured across Bengal. Whether it is Sandeshkhali or RG Kar, women are not safe here..."Reacting to Shah's allegations of infiltration across the border, TMC spokesperson Kunal Ghosh said, "Raising the infiltration bogey in Bengal, which Centre is supposed to stop, was akin to scoring a self goal." "If he (Shah) speaks on infiltration, he is presenting his own report card," Ghosh added.
Article Summary: 2026 will be a milestone in the assembly polls in Bengal, Amit Shah says. Shah: "Bengal is witnessing state-sponsored infiltration. To stop this, you have to vote BJP to govern the state" TMC spokesperson: "Raising the infiltration bogey in Bengal was akin to scoring a self goal"

Article Title: 2 women drug peddlers among six held across Jammu region; cash, contraband seized
Article Text: JAMMU: J&K Police on Sunday arrested six drug peddlers , including two women, in two separate cases from Nagrota and Udhampur , and seized a total of 284 gms of heroin-like substance and Rs 4 lakh cash from the possession of the accused persons.In Nagrota, acting on a tip-off, police arrested Shabir Choudhary, Shakeel Ahmed, Farooq Choudhary, and Waseem Akram selling narcotics in an SUV near TCP bypass area, while Arif Choudhary fled away after seeing the police party. Police seized 265 gms of heroin-like substance worth 27 lakhs along with Rs 4,05,700 cash from the dashboard of the vehicle.In Udhampur, two women drug peddlers — Halima and Nishad Begum -- were caught selling drugs in the Debrah area of Krimchi, police said. About 19 gms of heroine-like substance was recovered from both women.Police have registered FIRs in both cases under the relevant sections of the NDPS Act. Further probe in on.
Article Summary: Police seized 284 gms of heroin-like substance and Rs 4 lakh cash from the possession of the accused persons. In Nagrota, acting on a tip-off, police arrested Shabir Choudhary, Shakeel Ahmed, Farooq Choud hary, and Waseem Akram selling narcotics. In Udhampur, two women drug peddlers — Halima and Nishad Begum — were caught selling drugs in the Debrah area of Krimchi.

Article Text: Jammu: Three men died on the spot when an oil tanker collided with a motorcycle on Jammu-Srinagar national highway near Nagrota Sunday, police said.Two of the deceased have been identified as Sumit Bargotra, 20, and Gourav, 19, both residents of Indra Colony in Janipur, Jammu. Identity of the third, in his early 20s, is being ascertained, police said.The oil tanker driver has been arrested. The bodies have been shifted to Govt Medical College and Hospital for postmortem.
Article Summary: Two of the deceased identified as Sumit Bargotra, 20, and Gourav, 19. Identity of the third, in his early 20s, is being ascertained, police said. The oil tanker driver has been arrested. The bodies have been shifted to Govt Medical College and Hospital for postmortem.

Article Title: 'Differences natural in a family': RSS scotches talk of rift with BJP
Article Text: NEW DELHI: Ahead of state elections in Maharashtra and Jharkhand, RSS has dispelled notions of discord with BJP, particularly following remarks by party president J P Nadda which suggested that BJP was "self-sufficient" and did not require the Sangh's support.RSS general secretary Dattatreya Hosabale addressed the issue in Mathura, clarifying that the Sangh understood Nadda's intentions. "We understand the sentiment behind his comments. It's about fostering independence, not about severing ties. I visited him for a meal at his residence, highlighting our familial bond. Differences in a family are natural and are resolved privately. The Sangh does not engage in public disputes."Hosabale's comments came in the wake of BJP's below par performance in Lok Sabha elections, where some analysts suggested that a perceived lack of enthusiasm from RSS might have contributed to the party's reduced numbers. However, Hosabale clarified Nadda's stance and said, "His message was about BJP standing on its own feet, which is a reflection of strength, not a sign of division." He dismissed media reports of friction between the two organisations as attempts to sow discord, asserting that unity was paramount for any organisation's success.The clarification could bolster BJP's campaign in Maharashtra and Jharkhand, where RSS enjoys significant grassroots support. The strategic alignment is poised to influence the polls, showcasing a united front between BJP and RSS.
Article Summary: RSS general secretary Dattatreya Hosabale addressed the issue in Mathura, clarifying that the Sangh understood Nadda's intentions. He dismissed media reports of friction between the two organisations as attempts to sow discord, asserting that unity was paramount for any organisation's success.

Article Title: NCP-SP pits Swara's hubby Fahad against Sana Malik
Article Text: MUMBAI: Actor Swara Bhasker 's husband, Fahad Ahmad , will be Sharad Pawar-led NCP's nominee from Anushaktinagar for the assembly election. Ajit Pawar's NCP has fielded former minister Nawab Malik's daughter Sana Malik from the constituency. Ahmad's candidature has surprised even NCP (SP) functionaries, who were expecting a local functionary to get the ticket.State NCP (SP) president Jayant Patil said Ahmad was associated with Samajwadi Party-he was president of Samajwadi Party Yuvjan Sabha-and joined NCP (SP) a few days ago. "We felt that he was a suitable candidate. We are sure he will win with a massive margin," Patil said.Besides Ahmad, NCP (SP) nominated Gnayak Patni from Karanja, Atul Wandile from Hinghanghat, Ramesh Bang from Hingna, Rahul Kalate from Chinchwad, Ajit Gavhane from Bhosari, Mohan Bajirao Jagtap from Mazalgaon, Rajesaheb Deshmukh from Parli and Siddhi Kadam from Mohol. Patil said so far, NCP has declared 76 candidates-67 in first two lists and nine in the third.
Article Summary: Actor Swara Bhasker's husband, Fahad Ahmad, will be Sharad Pawar-led NCP's nominee from Anushaktinagar. Ahmad's candidature has surprised even NCP (SP) functionaries, who were expecting a local functionary to get the ticket.

Article Title: Jharkhand Election Schedule 2024: Jharkhand assembly elections to be held in two phases on November 13, 20: Full schedule
Article Text:
File photos

Check Jharkhand Assembly Elections 2024 full schedule here:

Events Date Phase 1 voting November 13 Phase 2 voting November 20 Results November 23

Also Read:

The Election Commission of India (ECI) on Tuesday announced dates for the Jharkhand assembly elections , which will be held on November 13 and 20 in two phases. The results will be declared on November 23, along with Maharashtra.In the Tribal-dominated state, the Bharatiya Janata Party (BJP) and CM Hemant's Soren Jharkhand Mukti Morcha (JMM) are in a direct fight, while the Congress party and Lalu Yadav's Rashtriya Janata Dal (RJD) are in alliance with the JMM.The JMM-Congress-RJD alliance are also reportedly seeking to deal with Left parties, Arvind Kejriwal's Aam Aadmi Party and other tribal outfits that have been contesting the elections in the state as independent entities and make efforts to field candidates against the BJP-led National Democratic Alliance (NDA) on all 81 seats collectively.In the last assembly polls in 2019, the JMM-Congress-RJD alliance won a comfortable majority of 47 seats in a House of 81.The BJP slipped to 25 seats from 37 it held in 2014. The poor performance was perceived to be the outcome of its decision to contest alone backfiring. The party did not foster an alliance with the Ajsu in the 2019 polls when Raghubar Das, currently the Odisha governor, was serving the state as CM.In this year's Lok Sabha polls in Jharkhand, the BJP-led NDA secured nine out of the 14 seats, with the BJP winning eight and its alliance partner, the Ajsu (All Jharkhand Students Union) Party, retaining its single seat.On the other hand, the opposition India bloc improved its tally, increasing its seat count from two in 2019 to five in the parliamentary polls.BJP and JMM have spruced up their pace of campaigning from the ground zero to social media. BJP and JMM leaders are actively rebutting and challenging each other on a range of issues, including illegal immigration, youth welfare, employment and housing.INDIA bloc parties in Jharkhand slammed the EC for holding assembly elections in the state along with that of Maharashtra but claimed that they were ready to slug it out with BJP-led NDA, which has welcomed the announcement of poll dates.JMM, Congress, and CPI (ML-L) said the announcement showed that EC was in a hurry to conduct elections though the assembly tenure was due to end in January next year.Also, both the INDIA bloc and BJP-led NDA are expected to get into huddles to discuss the modalities of seat-sharing which is going to be a challenge for both the competing teams.
Article Summary: The Election Commission of India (ECI) on Tuesday announced dates for the Jharkhand assembly elections, which will be held on November 13 and 20 in two phases. The results will be declared on November 23, along with Maharashtra. The Bharatiya Janata Party (BJP) and CM Hemant's Soren Jharkshand Mukti Morcha (JMM) are in a direct fight.

Article Title: Maharashtra elections 2024 schedule: Single phase voting on November 20, results on November 23
Article Text:
Check full schedule of Maharashtra assembly elections 2024 here:

Poll events Date Date of issue of gazette notification October 22 Last date of making notifications October 29 Date of scrutiny of nominations October 30 Last date of withdrawal of candidature November 4 Date of poll November 20 Date of counting November 23 Date before which election shall be completed November 25

NEW DELHI: The Election Commission of India on Tuesday announced the assembly election dates for the state of Maharashtra. Elections in Maharashtra will be held in single phase on November 20. The counting of votes will be on November 23.Maharashtra is gearing up for elections as the two major political alliances—the Maha Vikas Aghadi (MVA) and the Mahayuti—prepare to face each other for the first time in a Vidhan Sabha election.The Maha Vikas Aghadi, comprise of the Congress, the Shiv Sena (Uddhav Balasaheb Thackeray), and the Nationalist Congress Party (NCP) under Sharad Pawar, will go head-to-head with the Mahayuti , which includes the Bharatiya Janata Party (BJP), the Shiv Sena faction led by Eknath Shinde, and the NCP faction led by Ajit Pawar. This will be the first electoral contest between these two alliances since the splits within the Shiv Sena and NCP.The MVA is hopeful of replicating its recent Lok Sabha success, while the Mahayuti aims to retain power by leveraging its populist schemes targeted at women and youth. Both alliances have set their sights on winning the state.Narayan Rane, a former Union Minister and the victor in the Ratnagiri-Sindhudurg Lok Sabha constituency, is poised to be a key figure for the BJP in the Konkan region during the forthcoming elections. Meanwhile, two constituencies are expected to be critical battlegrounds: chief minister Eknath Shinde's Kopri-Pachpakdi seat in Thane City and Worli in Mumbai, where Aaditya Thackeray, a leader of the Shiv Sena (UBT), is seeking reelection.In the last Vidhan Sabha elections in 2019, the BJP secured 26.1% of the votes, the Congress 16.1%, the NCP 16.9%, and the Shiv Sena 16.6%. The BJP and the Shiv Sena (then united) formed the National Democratic Alliance (NDA), which secured a majority. However, the coalition soon crumbled due to disagreements over government formation, plunging the state into a political crisis.After no party could establish a government, Maharashtra was placed under President's rule. Devendra Fadnavis was briefly sworn in as chief minister, with Ajit Pawar as deputy chief minister. However, both resigned just days later before a scheduled floor test.By November 28, 2019, a new coalition emerged, with the Shiv Sena (Uddhav faction), NCP (Sharad Pawar faction), and Congress forming the Maha Vikas Aghadi government, led by Uddhav Thackeray as chief minister.The state's politics took another turn in June, 2022, when Uddhav Thackeray resigned following a rebellion within the Shiv Sena, led by Eknath Shinde, who then allied with the BJP. Eknath Shinde assumed the role of chief minister, with Devendra Fadnavis returning as deputy chief minister.
Article Summary: The Election Commission of India on Tuesday announced the assembly election dates for the state of Maharashtra. Elections in Maharashtra will be held in single phase on November 20. The counting of votes will be on November 23. This will be the first electoral contest between these two alliances since the splits within the Shiv Sena and NCP.

Article Title: Amit Shah claims Bengal govt aiding infiltration, shares BJP's 'next big target'
Article Text:
Union home minister Amit Shah (PTI photo)

NEW DELHI: Union home minister Amit Shah on Sunday accused the chief minister Mamata Banerjee-led West Bengal government of "aiding infiltration " and said the Bharatiya Janata Party 's (BJP) "next big target" is to form government in the 2026 Bengal assembly elections."I have come to tell the youth of Bengal that if you want to stop the illegal infiltration of foreigners in this country, then the only way is to form BJP government in 2026 in Bengal," Amit Shah said while addressing the membership drive in Kolkata."State-sponsored infiltration in Bengal has to be stopped," he further said, according to news agency PTI.Shah also hit out at the Mamata government over the RG Kar rape-murder incident that took place on August 9 when a trainee doctor was raped before she was killed, trigging nationwide protests demanding the security of women at workplaces."Incidents of Sandeshkhali, RG Kar prove that our mothers and sisters are not safe in Bengal", Amit Shah said.The Union minister also took a dig at Rahul Gandhi in the backdrop of the Congress party being upbeat about this year's Lok Sabha performance, saying those who win take the PM oath and not sit in the chair of opposition."Rahul Gandhi said in Parliament that they defeated us in the Lok Sabha elections. I don't understand why his allies don't explain it to him that those who lose sit in the chair of opposition and who wins, takes the oath as the PM," Amit Shah said.This was Amit Shah's first visit to West Bengal after the parliamentary polls in April-May, and also after the RG Kar incident.
Article Summary: BJP's next big target is to form government in the 2026 Bengal assembly elections. Amit Shah also hit out at the Mamata government over the RG Kar rape- murder incident. Shah also took a dig at Rahul Gandhi, saying those who win take the PM oath and not the chair of opposition.

Article Title: 2 Tirupati hotels, local temple get fresh bomb threats
Article Text:
TOI photo

TIRUPATI: Police in the temple city of Tirupati remained on high alert for the third consecutive day on Sunday, after fresh bomb threat emails were sent to a local temple of the Tirumala Tirupati Devasthanams and two hotels.While hotels in the city have been receiving hoax bomb threats via emails for the last three days, this is the first time that a bomb threat was sent to a TTD temple in the city.Tirupati police once again pressed in the services of the bomb squad and the dog squads and thoroughly screened Hotel Renest and Paid Viceroy near the Kapila Teertham circle in the city earlier in the day.Intensified searches were also carried out at Sri Varadharaja Swamy temple in the city, which is located adjacent to the TTD administrative building on Sunday.The bomb threat emails once again mentioned the name of alleged drug kingpin Jaffer Sadiq and the ISI.At the end of the searches, Tirupati police stated that no explosives were found anywhere and once again the bomb threat emails turned out to be a hoax call.Meanwhile, the Tirupati police and the cyber crime department have intensified their probe into the hoax bomb threat emails case even as the temple city continues to receive fresh bomb threat emails on a daily basis over the last three days.
Article Summary: Police in the temple city of Tirupati remained on high alert for the third consecutive day on Sunday. Fresh bomb threat emails were sent to a local temple and two hotels. Hotel Renest and Paid Viceroy near the Kapila Teertham circle in the city earlier in the day.

Article Title: For Bandra West, it’s the same candidates, the same issues
Article Text: MUMBAI: Bandra West will see a familiar fight: sitting MLA Ashish Shelar will square off once again with former BMC corporator and Congress member Asif Zakaria . Zakaria had run against Shelar in 2019, too, but lost by a margin of 26,507 votes.Earlier this month, there were reports that former MP Priya Dutt might contest the seat, but Dutt reportedly instead recommended Zakaria, a three-term civic corporator from the area. She took to X to congratulate Zakaria late Saturday after his candidature was announced.While the key challengers remain the same, Mumbai North-Central constituency, which covers this assembly seat, has a new MP: Congress's Varsha Gaikwad defeated BJP's Ujwal Nikam in the Lok Sabha elections. Prior to Gaikwad, BJP's Poonam Mahajan represented the seat for two consecutive terms.For residents in this assembly constituency, which includes some of Mumbai's most active advanced locality management groups, key concerns include managing the boom in restaurants and pubs, congested roads and late night noise. Additionally, locals are calling for better regulation of hawkers, a resolution on illegal slum encroachments in Nargis Dutt Nagar, Nityanand Nagar and Gazdarbandh, and a stronger focus on an eco-friendly Bandra.Shelar's agenda for the next five years is to rehabilitate slums and ease traffic. Zakaria said people are disgruntled as there has been a lot of wasteful expenditure, especially in the name of beautification projects that are later abandoned. "I wish to be that bridge so that pending works are completed," he said.
Article Summary: Sitting MLA Ashish Shelar will square off with former BMC corporator and Congress member Asif Zakaria. Zakaria had run against Shelar in 2019, too, but lost by a margin of 26,507 votes. Shelar's agenda for the next five years is to rehabilitate slums and ease traffic.

Article Title: Jharkhand a tough battleground but we hope to do well: Sarma
Article Text: GUWAHATI: Assam CM Himanta Biswa Sarma BJP 's Jharkhand co-in-charge for assembly polls , described the state as a "tough battleground," while affirming that the party will "leave no stone unturned in its endeavour to secure victory."While five constituencies in Assam are also set for bypolls, Sarma has been dedicating minimal time to it, instead choosing to focus primarily on campaigning in Jharkhand."We are trying our best, but Jharkhand is a tough state to win. Hope we do well in the polls," Sarma told mediapersons. "I am extremely preoccupied with Jharkhand elections . I have limited information regarding Assam bypolls and have asked our ministers and party members to oversee the campaign. I am uncertain as to whether I will be able to participate in campaigning here."
Article Summary: Assam CM Himanta Biswa Sarma is co-in-charge for assembly polls in Jharkhand. Five constituencies in Assam are also set for bypolls. Sarma has been dedicating minimal time to it, instead choosing to focus primarily on campaigning.

Article Title: Georgia's Russia-tied governing party wins in disputed election
Article Text: Georgia 's governing party won nearly 54.8% of the vote in Saturday's parliamentary election , the electoral commission said Sunday, as opposition parties disputed the result. It was a blow for pro-Western Georgians who had cast the election as a choice between a Russia-linked governing party and an opposition aiming to fast-track integration with Europe. Governing Georgian Dream, headed for a fourth term , will take 89 seats, with four pro-Western opposition parties receiving 61 seats in total. Georgia's governing party won nearly 54.8% of the vote in Saturday's parliamentary election, the electoral commission said Sunday, as opposition parties disputed the result. It was a blow for pro-Western Georgians who had cast the election as a choice between a Russia-linked governing party and an opposition aiming to fast-track integration with Europe. Governing Georgian Dream, headed for a fourth term , will take 89 seats, with four pro-Western opposition parties receiving 61 seats in total.
Article Summary: Governing Georgian Dream, headed for a fourth term, will take 89 seats, with four pro-Western opposition parties receiving 61 seats in total. It was a blow for pro- Western Georgians who had cast the election as a choice between a Russia-linked governing party and an opposition aiming to fast-track integration with Europe.
